Setting up an attribute input mask
The mask is specified when it is necessary to have a single format for input of attribute values (e.g. input fields for series and number of passport or ten-digit phone number).
The input mask is defined by a regular expression
, that is, by a string of characters indicating the format of valid input data values.
Most characters in regular expressions represent themselves. The exception is a group of special characters "[ ] \ / ^ $ . | ?
+ ( ) \{ }". If these characters need to be represented as text, use a backslash "\" escape character.

Special metacharacters of regular expressions allow to replace some prepared constructions.
Character
Definition
\b
Indicates the boundary between characters (not a character).
\d
Digital character.
\D
Non-digital character.
\s
Space character.
\S
Non-space character.
\w
An alphabetic or numeric character. It can also be an underscore.
\W
Any character other than an alphabetic or numeric character, and underscore.

Example 4
It is necessary to specify the mask of technical certificate, where two additional characters
may possibly
be entered.
The entry \{0,2} implies that 0 or 2 characters can be entered in the field. The [A-Z0-9] expression implies that numbers and/or English capitol letters can be entered. The configured attribute mask will allow to enter only six-digit number.
